title: Code formatting standardisation with gofmt and goimports
description: Run gofmt and goimports across the entire codebase to ensure consistent formatting and import organisation. gofmt enforces the canonical Go formatting style, while goimports additionally groups and sorts imports into standard library, external, and internal groups. This is a zero-risk operation that changes only whitespace and import ordering.
acceptance_criteria: gofmt -l . reports zero files (all files already formatted)
goimports -l . reports zero files (all imports correctly grouped)
Imports follow standard Go convention: stdlib, blank line, external, blank line, internal
No functional changes - only whitespace and import ordering

approach: 1. Run gofmt -l . to see which files need formatting
2. Run gofmt -w . to apply formatting fixes
3. Run goimports -l . to see which files have import issues
4. Run goimports -w -local jim-dot-tennis . to fix imports with correct local prefix
6. Review diff to confirm only whitespace/import changes
technical_notes.goimports_local_flag: jim-dot-tennis - ensures internal packages are grouped separately from external dependencies

testing_requirements: git diff shows only whitespace and import ordering changes

context.user_story: As a developer, I want all Go code formatted consistently so diffs are clean and code style is never a concern during reviews
